Docs.summary: Provides an editor for selecting message body files in a object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MailDefinitionBodyFileNameEditor> class provides a user interface for selecting a file for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MailDefinition.BodyFileName%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MailDefinition> object. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MailDefinition.BodyFileName%2A> specifies the file that contains the e-mail message body.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MailDefinition> objects define the content and format of the e-mail notification messages that are sent by controls. For example, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CreateUserWizard>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> controls use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MailDefinitionBodyFileNameEditor>.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MailDefinitionBodyFileNameEditor> is invoked, for example, by selecting the ellipsis (**…**) button on the **BodyFileName** property, under **MailDefinition**, in the **Properties** grid of the visual designer.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MailDefinitionBodyFileNameEditor.Caption%2A> property specifies the caption that is to appear on the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MailDefinitionBodyFileNameEditor> form. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MailDefinitionBodyFileNameEditor.Filter%2A> property returns the list of file types that is to be accepted by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MailDefinitionBodyFileNameEditor>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The .NET Framework internally constructs a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MailDefinitionBodyFileNameEditor> class when you invoke the editor in a control that encapsulates a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MailDefinition> object. For example, you select the ellipsis (**…**) button on the **BodyFileName** property, under **MailDefinition**, in the **Properties** grid of the visual designer, when designing a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CreateUserWizard>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control.

Docs.summary: Gets the caption to appear on the form.
Docs.value: A string that is the caption to appear on the editor form.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default value for the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MailDefinitionBodyFileNameEditor.Caption%2A> property is a message instructing the user to select an e-mail file.

block.para: Override the property to return a value that is different than the default. The default value is localized.

Docs.summary: Gets the list of file types for the object to accept.
Docs.value: A string specifying a user-friendly name for each accepted file type and file specifications for each type.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The format for the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MailDefinitionBodyFileNameEditor.Filter%2A> property for each type is as follows:
1. A user-friendly description.
2. A vertical bar (`|`).
3. File specifications, separated by a semicolon (`;`).
4. Another vertical bar (`|`).
For example, a filter that specifies text files, HTML files, and all files would look like the following example, in EN-US locale:
`Text Files(*.txt)|*.txt|HTML Files(*.htm;*.html)|*.htm;*.html|All Files(*.*)|*.*|`
A localized version of this string is the default value for the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MailDefinitionBodyFileNameEditor.Filter%2A>.

block.para: Override the property to return a value that is different from the default.
